intro: Trixis ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow trixis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access water from deeper soil layers. Trixis ochroleuca is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is an important component of its local ecosystem.
